private_information: You specialize in turning informal operator descriptions into a clean canonical action schema (parameters, preconditions, add-effects, delete-effects).
Do not emit PDDL; produce a structured JSON-like schema instead.
domain_modeler.goal: Extract a precise, implementation-agnostic action schema for all actions from the public information and express it in a canonical intermediate schema (CIS).

private_information: You construct problem instances from human statements.
Represent objects, initial facts, and goals in the same CIS used by the domain modeler.
problem_curator.goal: Produce two CIS problem instances that exactly match the two human statements (initial conditions and goals).

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of plans against the CIS domain and problems.
You must remove or disallow bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or other non-causal devices.
If a supplied plan is invalid, minimally repair it; if no plan is supplied, propose one or explain why none exists.
consistency_auditor.goal: Validate and, if needed, repair the supplied plan for instance_1; attempt a plan for instance_2. Ensure causal soundness with respect to preconditions and effects.

private_information: You unify symbol names and arities across all CIS artifacts.
Ensure consistent predicate, action, and object naming and a single canonical set of symbols.
symbol_mapper.goal: Return a unified CIS domain and unified CIS problems and plans where all symbols are consistent and refer to the same entities.

private_information: You coordinate all other agents and are responsible for producing the final PDDL artifacts.
Target the FastDownward solver with a clean STRIPS-style domain and problem files.
Keep the action semantics faithful to the unified CIS; do not introduce new shortcuts.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the unified CIS domain, problems, and audited plans and output a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problems suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: Actions available: Paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; Sip object_0 object_1 object_2; Clip object_0 object_1 object_2; Wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; Memory object_0 object_1 object_2; Tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.

Paltry preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Paltry add-effects: next object_0 object_2. Paltry delete-effects: vase object_0 object_1.
Sip preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Sip add-effects: vase object_0 object_1. Sip delete-effects: next object_0 object_2.

Clip preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Clip add-effects: vase object_0 object_1. Clip delete-effects: next object_0 object_2.

Wretched preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Wretched add-effects: next object_0 object_2. Wretched delete-effects: next object_0 object_1.
Memory preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Memory add-effects: next object_0 object_2. Memory delete-effects: next object_0 object_1.

Tightfisted preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Tightfisted add-effects: next object_0 object_2. Tightfisted delete-effects: vase object_0 object_1.

cis_domain.system_prompt: You convert informal operator descriptions into a canonical intermediate schema (CIS) with fields: actions[name, parameters, preconditions, add_effects, del_effects]. Do not emit PDDL.
cis_domain.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. From the public information, extract a complete CIS action set for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Ensure argument order and predicate arities match the facts. Return a single JSON object with the array actions.

instances.system_prompt: You build problem instances in the same CIS as the domain modeler. Do not emit PDDL.
instances.prompt: Your name is problem_curator. Using the environment instances, produce two CIS problems named instance_1 and instance_2 with fields: name, objects, init (facts), goal (facts). Keep facts verbatim and ensure all objects used in facts appear in the objects list.

audit.system_prompt: You audit and repair plans for temporal and causal consistency against CIS domain and problems. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Validate the provided plan for instance_1 against the CIS domain and instance_1; if invalid, provide a minimally repaired plan. For instance_2, attempt to construct a valid plan or explain infeasibility if applicable. Return a JSON object with keys: instance_1_plan (list of steps), instance_1_notes, instance_2_plan (list of steps or empty), instance_2_notes.

unify.system_prompt: You unify symbol names and ensure consistent, canonical naming across domain, problems, and plans. Do not emit PDDL.
unify.prompt: Your name is symbol_mapper. Produce a JSON object with keys: domain (unified CIS domain), problems (map of name to CIS problem), plans (map of name to list of steps). Ensure predicates, actions, and objects match exactly across all artifacts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL for FastDownward. You must output one PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files derived from the unified CIS. Use STRIPS-style predicates and effects, avoid conditional effects, and preserve action semantics. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and each PDDL problem between separate <problem></problem> tags. Ensure requirements include :strips and optionally :typing if you introduce types.
pddl.prompt: There are two planning instances sharing one domain. Use the unified CIS domain and problems to produce: a PDDL domain named logistics13-domain and two PDDL problems named logistics13-prob1 and logistics13-prob2. Targets FastDownward compatibility. Include all predicates used by the actions and problems. Do not invent new predicates or shortcuts.
